column1: Carrollton is a voluntary member of the North Central Texas Council of Governments association
column2: the purpose of which is to coordinate individual and collective local governments and facilitate regional solutions

column1: Carrollton has a city council that consists of seven members and a mayor. The current mayor is Kevin Falconer. The city council is responsible for establishing city policies
column2: considering city resolutions and ordinances
column3: appointing citizens to various city boards and commissions
column4: adopting the city's Comprehensive Plan and annual budget
column5: and approving or rejecting zoning changes. It meets on the first and third Tuesday of every month.

column1: Most of Carrollton is a part of the Carrollton-Farmers Branch Independent School District. Dallas Independent School District also serves a small portion of Carrollton in the south
column2: along with the Lewisville Independent School District in the north.

column1: CFBISD operates three high schools in Carrollton: Newman Smith High School
column2: R.L. Turner High School
column3: and Creekview High School. Lewisville ISD operates Hebron High School.

column1: The DISD portion is served partially by Jerry R. Junkins Elementary School in Carrollton

column3: and W. T. White High School in Dallas. Private schools in the area include The Saint Anthony School
column4: Carrollton Christian Academy. At one time Coram Deo Academy had a campus in Carrollton.The Japanese School of Dallas

column1: Carrollton is connected to the Metroplex's highway network by Interstate 35E and the President George Bush Turnpike
column2: as well as the Sam Rayburn Tollway at the far north end of the city.

column1: Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport is five miles southwest of Carrollton
column2: and Dallas Love Field is eight miles south.

column1: The Green Line of Dallas Area Rapid Transit's DART Rail system terminates at North Carrollton/Frankford Station and has additional stops within the city limits at Trinity Mills and Downtown Carrollton. Trinity Mills is also the southern terminus of Denton County's A-train
column2: which provides service to Lewisville and Denton. Downtown Carrollton is a planned stop on DART's Silver Line
column3: which is under construction and expected to open in late 2022.
